intro: Notholaena ekmanii, commonly known as the Ekman's spikerush, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance and specialized growth habits. The plant typically grows in wetlands and disturbed soils, showcasing its adaptability to moist environments. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small, three-ranked flowers. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a conservation concern.
